intro: Souroubea didyma, commonly known as the twin-leaf souroubea, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive twin leaves that are often opposite on the stem. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is typically found in moist, shaded habitats. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
